abstract.description:
Simulated dataset TTJets_HadronicMGDecays_8TeV-madgraph enriched with tracker hit data for tracking algorithm studies in AODSIM format for 2012 collision data.

See the description of the simulated dataset names in: About CMS simulated dataset names.

These simulated datasets correspond to the collision data collected by the CMS experiment in 2012. They were released in the context of data science sample production.

methodology.description: These data were generated in several steps (see also CMS Monte Carlo production overview):

configuration_files.title: FIXME: Modified SIM config to produce the file in the open data env https://github.com/emanueleusai/opendatadnn/blob/master/step0_ttbar_V27.py
FIXME: Modified configuration file for HLT step to keep tracker recHits https://github.com/emanueleusai/opendatadnn/blob/master/step1_ttbar_V27.py
Modified c onfiguration file for RECO step to keep tracker recHits https://github.com/emanueleusai/opendatadnn/blob/master/step2_ttbar_V27.py

pileup.description: To make these simulated data comparable with the collision data, pile-up events are added to the simulated event in this step.

title: Trakcer-hit-enriched
title_additional: Simulated dataset TTJets_HadronicMGDecays_8TeV-madgraph enriched with tracker hits in AODSIM format for 2012 collision data

usage.description: You can access these data through the CMS Virtual Machine. See the instructions for setting up the Virtual Machine and getting started in

links.description: How to install the CMS Virtual Machine
Getting started with CMS open data

validation.description: The generation and simulation of simulated Monte Carlo data has been validated through general CMS validation procedures.
